article.para: The following is a list of known bugs and issues with the auto-installation system in SuSE Linux 8.0.

refsect1.title: Applies to
refsect1.para: SuSE Linux Version 8.0

refsect1.title: Severity
refsect1.para: Major with workaround

refsect1.title: Symptom
refsect1.para: Retrieving the control file via network does not work in some cases. Using the following keyword on the command line results in an error.

refsect1.title: Cause
refsect1.para: Parsing the URL with a colon after the IP of the server fails.

refsect1.title: Solution
refsect1.para: Remove the second colon in the URL or update auto-installation module from the SuSE FTP server.

refsect1.title: Status
refsect1.para: Fixed, Update package available on official FTP server.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Root password not set when given as clear text

refsect1.title: Applies to
refsect1.para: SuSE Linux Version 8.0

refsect1.title: Severity
refsect1.para: Major with workaround

refsect1.title: Symptom
refsect1.para: See http://lists.suse.com/archive/suse-autoinstall/2002-May/0009.html

refsect1.title: Cause
refsect1.para: Root password in described case is not set.

refsect1.title: Solution
refsect1.para: Use encrypted password in the control file.

refsect1.title: Status
refsect1.para: Fixed, Update package available on FTP server.

refsect1.title: Applies to
refsect1.para: SuSE Linux Version 8.0

refsect1.title: Severity
refsect1.para: Major

refsect1.title: Symptom
refsect1.para: When more than 4 partitions are configured in the control file, no extended partiton is created. This problem occurs only when partitioning a harddisk from scratch.

refsect1.title: Cause
refsect1.para: Partition type is not changed during creation of partitions

refsect1.title: Solution
refsect1.para: Use update package.

refsect1.title: Status
refsect1.para: Fixed, Update package available on FTP server.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Routes are not set as specified in control file

refsect1.title: Applies to
refsect1.para: SuSE Linux Version 8.0

refsect1.title: Severity
refsect1.para: Major

refsect1.title: Symptom
refsect1.para: See http://lists.suse.com/archive/suse-autoinstall/2002-May/0010.html

refsect1.title: Cause
refsect1.para: Routes section is ignored due to a check for a parameter which is set during normal operation

refsect1.title: Solution
refsect1.para: Use update package for the network configuration module

refsect1.title: Status
refsect1.para: Fixed, Update package available on FTP server.

section.title: Using update packages
section.para: Update package available on official FTP server can be easily used with network installations (Over NFS) and in other cases only with custom made boot media (i.e. custom made CDs).
To use an update package, you can either copy the new RPM into the right series (yast1 or yast2) in the suse directory and overwrite the old package, even though it has a different name, i.e.

Or by removing the old package and replacing it with the new update package. This requires a change of the package information in suse/setup/descr/common.pkd. (At least Filename and Version fields of the package entry)

section.title: Using update packages during installation.
section.para: In this case you need unpack the root image which is available in the directory suse/image into a new directory under suse called inst-sys. To accomplish this, please follow the next example:
section.screen: cd <path to suse>/suse mkdir inst-sys cd inst-sys mount -oloop <path to suse>/suse/images/root /mnt cp -a /mnt/* .
section.para: Next time you install, YaST2 will be started from inst-sys instead of the root image. Changes in the inst-sys directory will affect the installation, so only make required changes.
